form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Barrasso (for himself, Ms. Lummis, Mr. Crapo, Mr. Risch, and Mr. Curtis) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 to clarify the nature of public involvement for purposes of certain rulemaking, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the American Voices in Federal Lands Act.

section.header: Public involvement in certain public land rulemaking

subsection.text: Section 103(d) of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 (43 U.S.C. 1702(d)) is amended by striking citizens and inserting citizens of the United States, in accordance with section 310(d), as applicable,.

subsection.header: Public involvement relating to certain rules and regulations
subsection.text: Section 310 of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 (43 U.S.C. 1740) is amended to read as follows:

paragraph.text: Subject to subsection (d), the Secretary, with respect to public lands, shall promulgate rules and regulations to carry out the purposes of—

subparagraph.text: other laws applicable to public lands.

paragraph.text: The Secretary of Agriculture, with respect to land in the National Forest System, shall promulgate rules and regulations to carry out the purposes of this Act.

subsection.text: The promulgation of rules and regulations pursuant to this section shall be in accordance with chapter 5 of title 5, United States Code, without regard to section 553(a)(2) of that title.

Before the promulgation of a rule or regulation pursuant to this section with respect to public lands or land in the National Forest System, the applicable land shall be administered under existing rules and regulations concerning the land, to the maximum extent practicable.

subsection.header: Public involvement relating to Bureau land
subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, with respect to public lands managed by the Bureau, the Secretary—

paragraph.text: in promulgating any applicable regulations pursuant to this or any other Act, may take into consideration only public comments received from citizens of the United States; and

in any public involvement under this Act or any other provision of law (including regulations), shall establish and implement a process commonly known as Completely Automated Public Test to tell Computers and Humans Apart (CAPTCHA) to deter attempts at public involvement via artificial intelligence.
